  • Element
org.apache.juneau.annotation

Annotation Type BeanConfig


  • @Documented
 @Target(value={TYPE,METHOD})
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Inherited
 @PropertyStoreApply(value=BeanConfigApply.class)
public @interface BeanConfig
    Annotation for specifying config properties defined in BeanContext and BeanTraverseContext.

    Used primarily for specifying bean configuration properties on REST classes and methods.

    • Optional Element Summary

      • rank

        public abstract int rank
        Optional rank for this config.

        Can be used to override default ordering and application of config annotations.

        Default:
        0

      • beanClassVisibility

        public abstract String beanClassVisibility
        Configuration property: Minimum bean class visibility.

        Classes are not considered beans unless they meet the minimum visibility requirements.

        For example, if the visibility is PUBLIC and the bean class is protected, then the class will not be interpreted as a bean class and be serialized as a string.
        Use this setting to reduce the visibility requirement.

        • Possible values:
          • "PUBLIC" (default)
          • "PROTECTED"
          • "DEFAULT"
          • "PRIVATE"
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanContext.BEAN_beanClassVisibility
        Default:
        ""

      • beanConstructorVisibility

        public abstract String beanConstructorVisibility
        Configuration property: Minimum bean constructor visibility.

        Only look for constructors with the specified minimum visibility.

        This setting affects the logic for finding no-arg constructors for bean.
        Normally, only public no-arg constructors are used.
        Use this setting if you want to reduce the visibility requirement.

        • Possible values:
          • "PUBLIC" (default)
          • "PROTECTED"
          • "DEFAULT"
          • "PRIVATE"
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanContext.BEAN_beanConstructorVisibility
        Default:
        ""

      • beanDictionary

        @Deprecated
public abstract Class<?>[] beanDictionary
        Deprecated. 
        Configuration property: Bean dictionary.

        The list of classes that make up the bean dictionary in this bean context.

        A dictionary is a name/class mapping used to find class types during parsing when they cannot be inferred through reflection.
        The names are defined through the @Bean(typeName) annotation defined on the bean class.
        For example, if a class Foo has a type-name of "myfoo", then it would end up serialized as "{_type:'myfoo',...}".

        This setting tells the parsers which classes to look for when resolving "_type" attributes.

        • BeanContext.BEAN_beanDictionary
        • Overview > juneau-marshall > Bean Names and Dictionaries
        Deprecated - dictionary().
        Default:
        {}

      • beanDictionary_replace

        @Deprecated
public abstract Class<?>[] beanDictionary_replace
        Deprecated. 
        Configuration property: Add to bean dictionary.
        • BeanContext.BEAN_beanDictionary
        Deprecated - dictionary_replace().
        Default:
        {}

        Configuration property: Remove from bean dictionary.
        • BeanContext.BEAN_beanDictionary_remove
        Deprecated - dictionary_remove().
        Default:
        {}

      • beanFieldVisibility

        public abstract String beanFieldVisibility
        Configuration property: Minimum bean field visibility.

        Only look for bean fields with the specified minimum visibility.

        This affects which fields on a bean class are considered bean properties.
        Normally only public fields are considered.
        Use this setting if you want to reduce the visibility requirement.

        • Possible values:
          • "PUBLIC" (default)
          • "PROTECTED"
          • "DEFAULT"
          • "PRIVATE"
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanContext.BEAN_beanFieldVisibility
        Default:
        ""

      • beanFilters

        public abstract Class<?>[] beanFilters
        Configuration property: Bean filters.

        This is a programmatic equivalent to the @Bean annotation.
        It's useful when you want to use the @Bean annotation functionality, but you don't have the ability to alter the bean classes.

        • Values can consist of any of the following types:
          • Any subclass of BeanFilterBuilder.
            These must have a public no-arg constructor.
          • Any bean interfaces.
            A shortcut for defining a InterfaceBeanFilterBuilder.
            Any subclasses of an interface class will only have properties defined on the interface.
            All other bean properties will be ignored.
        • BeanContext.BEAN_beanFilters
        • Overview > juneau-marshall > Transforms > BeanFilter Class
        • Overview > juneau-marshall > Transforms > Interface Filters
        Default:
        {}

      • beanFilters_replace

        public abstract Class<?>[] beanFilters_replace
        Configuration property: Add to bean filters.
        • BeanContext.BEAN_beanFilters
        Default:
        {}

      • beanFilters_remove

        public abstract Class<?>[] beanFilters_remove
        Configuration property: Remove from bean filters.
        • BeanContext.BEAN_beanFilters_remove
        Default:
        {}

      • beanMapPutReturnsOldValue

        public abstract String beanMapPutReturnsOldValue
        Configuration property: BeanMap.put() returns old property value.

        If "true", then the BeanMap.put() method will return old property values.
        Otherwise, it returns null.

        • Possible values:
          • "true"
          • "false" (default because it introduces a slight performance penalty during serialization)
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanContext.BEAN_beanMapPutReturnsOldValue
        Default:
        ""

      • beanMethodVisibility

        public abstract String beanMethodVisibility
        Configuration property: Minimum bean method visibility.

        Only look for bean methods with the specified minimum visibility.

        This affects which methods are detected as getters and setters on a bean class.
        Normally only public getters and setters are considered.
        Use this setting if you want to reduce the visibility requirement.

        • Possible values:
          • "PUBLIC" (default)
          • "PROTECTED"
          • "DEFAULT"
          • "PRIVATE"
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanContext.BEAN_beanMethodVisibility
        Default:
        ""

      • beansRequireDefaultConstructor

        public abstract String beansRequireDefaultConstructor
        Configuration property: Beans require no-arg constructors.

        If "true", a Java class must implement a default no-arg constructor to be considered a bean.
        Otherwise, the bean will be serialized as a string using the Object.toString() method.

        • Possible values:
          • "true"
          • "false" (default)
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • The @Bean annotation can be used on a class to override this setting when "true".
        • BeanContext.BEAN_beansRequireDefaultConstructor
        Default:
        ""

      • beansRequireSerializable

        public abstract String beansRequireSerializable
        Configuration property: Beans require Serializable interface.

        If "true", a Java class must implement the Serializable interface to be considered a bean.
        Otherwise, the bean will be serialized as a string using the Object.toString() method.

        • Possible values:
          • "true"
          • "false" (default)
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • The @Bean annotation can be used on a class to override this setting when "true".
        • BeanContext.BEAN_beansRequireSerializable
        Default:
        ""

      • beansRequireSettersForGetters

        public abstract String beansRequireSettersForGetters
        Configuration property: Beans require setters for getters.

        If "true", only getters that have equivalent setters will be considered as properties on a bean.
        Otherwise, they will be ignored.

        • Possible values:
          • "true"
          • "false" (default)
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanContext.BEAN_beansRequireSettersForGetters
        Default:
        ""

      • beansRequireSomeProperties

        public abstract String beansRequireSomeProperties
        Configuration property: Beans require at least one property.

        If "true", then a Java class must contain at least 1 property to be considered a bean.
        Otherwise, the bean will be serialized as a string using the Object.toString() method.

        • Possible values:
          • "true" (default)
          • "false"
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanContext.BEAN_beansRequireSomeProperties
        Default:
        ""

      • beanTypePropertyName

        public abstract String beanTypePropertyName
        Configuration property: Bean type property name.

        This specifies the name of the bean property used to store the dictionary name of a bean type so that the parser knows the data type to reconstruct.

        • Default value: "_type".
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanContext.BEAN_beanTypePropertyName
        Default:
        ""

      • bpi

        public abstract String[] bpi
        Configuration property: Bean property includes. Shortcut for specifying the BeanContext.BEAN_bpi property on all serializers.

        The typical use case is when you're rendering summary and details views of the same bean in a resource and you want to expose or hide specific properties depending on the level of detail you want.

        In the example below, our 'summary' view is a list of beans where we only want to show the ID property, and our detail view is a single bean where we want to expose different fields:

        // Our bean public class MyBean { // Summary properties @Html(link="servlet:/mybeans/{id}") public String id; // Detail properties public String a, b; } // Only render "id" property. @RestMethod(name=GET, path="/mybeans") @BeanConfig(bpi="MyBean: id") public List<MyBean> getBeanSummary() {...} // Only render "a" and "b" properties. @RestMethod(name=GET, path="/mybeans/{id}") @BeanConfig(bpi="MyBean: a,b") public MyBean getBeanDetails(@Path String id) {...}

        • The format of each value is: "Key: comma-delimited-tokens".
        • Keys can be fully-qualified or short class names or "*" to represent all classes.
        • Values are comma-delimited lists of bean property names.
        • Properties apply to specified class and all subclasses.
        • Semicolons can be used as an additional separator for multiple values:

          // Equivalent bpi={"Bean1: foo","Bean2: bar,baz"} bpi="Bean1: foo; Bean2: bar,baz"

        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanContext.BEAN_bpi
        Default:
        {}

      • bpiMap

        public abstract CS[] bpiMap
        Configuration property: Bean property includes.

        Specifies the set and order of names of properties associated with the bean class.

        Example:

        @BeanConfig( bpiMap={ @CS(key=MyBean.class, value="foo,bar") } )

        • Keys are the class applied to.
          Values are comma-delimited lists of property names.
        • Setting applies to specified class and all subclasses.
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanContext.BEAN_bpi
        Default:
        {}

      • bpx

        public abstract String[] bpx
        Configuration property: Bean property excludes. Shortcut for specifying the BeanContext.BEAN_bpx property on all serializers.

        Same as bpi() except you specify a list of bean property names that you want to exclude from serialization.

        In the example below, our 'summary' view is a list of beans where we want to exclude some properties:

        // Our bean public class MyBean { // Summary properties @Html(link="servlet:/mybeans/{id}") public String id; // Detail properties public String a, b; } // Don't show "a" and "b" properties. @RestMethod(name=GET, path="/mybeans") @BeanConfig(bpx="MyBean: a,b") public List<MyBean> getBeanSummary() {...} // Render all properties. @RestMethod(name=GET, path="/mybeans/{id}") public MyBean getBeanDetails(@Path String id) {...}

        • The format of each value is: "Key: comma-delimited-tokens".
        • Keys can be fully-qualified or short class names or "*" to represent all classes.
        • Values are comma-delimited lists of bean property names.
        • Properties apply to specified class and all subclasses.
        • Semicolons can be used as an additional separator for multiple values:

          // Equivalent bpx={"Bean1: foo","Bean2: bar,baz"} bpx="Bean1: foo; Bean2: bar,baz"

        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanContext.BEAN_bpx
        Default:
        {}

      • bpxMap

        public abstract CS[] bpxMap
        Configuration property: Bean property excludes.

        Specifies to exclude the specified list of properties for the specified bean class.

        Example:

        @BeanConfig( bpxMap={ @CS(key=MyBean.class, value="foo,bar") } )

        • Keys are the class applied to.
          Values are comma-delimited lists of property names.
        • Setting applies to specified class and all subclasses.
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanContext.BEAN_bpx
        Default:
        {}

      • bpro

        public abstract String[] bpro
        Configuration property: Read-only bean properties. Shortcut for specifying the BeanContext.BEAN_bpro property on all parsers.

        Specifies one or more properties on a bean that are read-only despite having valid getters. Serializers will serialize such properties as usual, but parsers will silently ignore them.

        Example:

        // Ignore 'a' and 'b' properties if they're present in the HTTP request body. @RestMethod(name=POST, path="/mybeans") @BeanConfig(bpro="MyBean: a,b") public void postMyBeans(List<MyBean> l) {...}

        • The format of each value is: "Key: comma-delimited-tokens".
        • Keys can be fully-qualified or short class names or "*" to represent all classes.
        • Values are comma-delimited lists of bean property names.
        • Properties apply to specified class and all subclasses.
        • Semicolons can be used as an additional separator for multiple values:

          // Equivalent bpro={"Bean1: foo","Bean2: bar,baz"} bpro="Bean1: foo; Bean2: bar,baz"

        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanContext.BEAN_bpro
        Default:
        {}

      • bproMap

        public abstract CS[] bproMap
        Configuration property: Read-only bean properties. Shortcut for specifying the BeanContext.BEAN_bpro property on all parsers.

        Specifies one or more properties on a bean that are read-only despite having valid getters. Serializers will serialize such properties as usual, but parsers will silently ignore them.

        Example:

        // Ignore 'a' and 'b' properties if they're present in the HTTP request body. @RestMethod(name=POST, path="/mybeans") @BeanConfig(bproMap={@CS(MyBean.class, "a,b")}) public void postMyBeans(List<MyBean> l) {...}

        • Values are comma-delimited lists of bean property names.
        • Properties apply to specified class and all subclasses.
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanContext.BEAN_bpro
        Default:
        {}

      • bpwo

        public abstract String[] bpwo
        Configuration property: Write-only bean properties. Shortcut for specifying the BeanContext.BEAN_bpwo property on all serializers.

        Specifies one or more properties on a bean that are write-only despite having valid setters. Parsers will parse such properties as usual, but serializers will silently ignore them.

        Example:

        // Ignore 'a' and 'b' properties when serializing the response body. @RestMethod(name=GET, path="/mybeans") @BeanConfig(bpwo="MyBean: a,b") public List<MyBean> getMyBeans() {...}

        • The format of each value is: "Key: comma-delimited-tokens".
        • Keys can be fully-qualified or short class names or "*" to represent all classes.
        • Values are comma-delimited lists of bean property names.
        • Properties apply to specified class and all subclasses.
        • Semicolons can be used as an additional separator for multiple values:

          // Equivalent bpwo={"Bean1: foo","Bean2: bar,baz"} bpwo="Bean1: foo; Bean2: bar,baz"

        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanContext.BEAN_bpwo
        Default:
        {}

      • bpwoMap

        public abstract CS[] bpwoMap
        Configuration property: Write-only bean properties. Shortcut for specifying the BeanContext.BEAN_bpwo property on all serializers.

        Specifies one or more properties on a bean that are write-only despite having valid setters. Parsers will parse such properties as usual, but serializers will silently ignore them.

        Example:

        // Ignore 'a' and 'b' properties if they're present in the HTTP request body. @RestMethod(name=GET, path="/mybeans") @BeanConfig(bpwoMap={@CS(MyBean.class, "a,b")}) public void List<MyBean> getMyBeans() {...}

        • Values are comma-delimited lists of bean property names.
        • Properties apply to specified class and all subclasses.
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanContext.BEAN_bpwo
        Default:
        {}

      • debug

        public abstract String debug
        Configuration property: Debug mode.

        Enables the following additional information during serialization:

        • When bean getters throws exceptions, the exception includes the object stack information in order to determine how that method was invoked.
        • Enables BeanTraverseContext.BEANTRAVERSE_detectRecursions.

        Enables the following additional information during parsing:

        • When bean setters throws exceptions, the exception includes the object stack information in order to determine how that method was invoked.
        • Possible values:
          • "true"
          • "false" (default)
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanContext.BEAN_debug
        Default:
        ""

      • dictionary

        public abstract Class<?>[] dictionary
        Configuration property: Bean dictionary.

        The list of classes that make up the bean dictionary in this bean context.

        A dictionary is a name/class mapping used to find class types during parsing when they cannot be inferred through reflection.
        The names are defined through the @Bean(typeName) annotation defined on the bean class.
        For example, if a class Foo has a type-name of "myfoo", then it would end up serialized as "{_type:'myfoo',...}".

        This setting tells the parsers which classes to look for when resolving "_type" attributes.

        • BeanContext.BEAN_beanDictionary
        • Overview > juneau-marshall > Bean Names and Dictionaries
        Default:
        {}

      • dictionary_replace

        public abstract Class<?>[] dictionary_replace
        Configuration property: Add to bean dictionary.
        • BeanContext.BEAN_beanDictionary
        Default:
        {}

      • dictionary_remove

        public abstract Class<?>[] dictionary_remove
        Configuration property: Remove from bean dictionary.
        • BeanContext.BEAN_beanDictionary_remove
        Default:
        {}

      • example

        public abstract CS[] example
        Configuration property: POJO examples.

        Specifies an example of the specified class.

        Examples are used in cases such as POJO examples in Swagger documents.

        Example:

        @BeanConfig( examples={ @CS(key=MyBean.class, value="{foo:'bar'}") } )

        • Setting applies to specified class and all subclasses.
        • Keys are the class of the example.
          Values are Simple-JSON representation of that class.
        • POJO examples can also be defined on classes via the following:
          • A static field annotated with @Example.
          • A static method annotated with @Example with zero arguments or one BeanSession argument.
          • A static method with name example with no arguments or one BeanSession argument.
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanContext.BEAN_examples
        Default:
        {}

      • examples

        public abstract String[] examples
        Configuration property: POJO examples.

        Same as example() but allows you to define examples as a Simple-JSON string.

        Example:

        @BeanConfig( examples={ "MyBean: {foo:'bar'}" // Could also be "{MyBean: {foo:'bar'}}" } )

        • Keys are the class of the example and can be the fully-qualified name or simple name.
          Values are Simple-JSON representation of that class.
        • The individual strings are concatenated together and the whole string is treated as a JSON Object.
          The leading and trailing '{' and '}' characters are optional.
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanContext.BEAN_examples
        Default:
        {}

      • excludeProperties

        @Deprecated
public abstract CS[] excludeProperties
        Deprecated. 
        Configuration property: Bean property excludes.
        Deprecated - bpxMap().
        Default:
        {}

      • fluentSetters

        public abstract String fluentSetters
        Configuration property: Find fluent setters.

        When enabled, fluent setters are detected on beans.

        Fluent setters must have the following attributes:

        • Public.
        • Not static.
        • Take in one parameter.
        • Return the bean itself.
        • Possible values:
          • "true"
          • "false" (default)
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanContext.BEAN_fluentSetters
        Default:
        ""

      • ignoreInvocationExceptionsOnGetters

        public abstract String ignoreInvocationExceptionsOnGetters
        Configuration property: Ignore invocation errors on getters.

        If "true", errors thrown when calling bean getter methods will silently be ignored.
        Otherwise, a BeanRuntimeException is thrown.

        • Possible values:
          • "true"
          • "false" (default)
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanContext.BEAN_ignoreInvocationExceptionsOnGetters
        Default:
        ""

      • ignoreInvocationExceptionsOnSetters

        public abstract String ignoreInvocationExceptionsOnSetters
        Configuration property: Ignore invocation errors on setters.

        If "true", errors thrown when calling bean setter methods will silently be ignored.
        Otherwise, a BeanRuntimeException is thrown.

        • Possible values:
          • "true"
          • "false" (default)
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanContext.BEAN_ignoreInvocationExceptionsOnSetters
        Default:
        ""

      • ignorePropertiesWithoutSetters

        public abstract String ignorePropertiesWithoutSetters
        Configuration property: Ignore properties without setters.

        If "true", trying to set a value on a bean property without a setter will silently be ignored.
        Otherwise, a RuntimeException is thrown.

        • Possible values:
          • "true" (default)
          • "false"
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanContext.BEAN_ignorePropertiesWithoutSetters
        Default:
        ""

      • ignoreUnknownBeanProperties

        public abstract String ignoreUnknownBeanProperties
        Configuration property: Ignore unknown properties.

        If "true", trying to set a value on a non-existent bean property will silently be ignored.
        Otherwise, a RuntimeException is thrown.

        • Possible values:
          • "true"
          • "false" (default)
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanContext.BEAN_ignoreUnknownBeanProperties
        Default:
        ""

      • ignoreUnknownNullBeanProperties

        public abstract String ignoreUnknownNullBeanProperties
        Configuration property: Ignore unknown properties with null values.

        If "true", trying to set a null value on a non-existent bean property will silently be ignored.
        Otherwise, a RuntimeException is thrown.

        • Possible values:
          • "true" (default)
          • "false"
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanContext.BEAN_ignoreUnknownNullBeanProperties
        Default:
        ""

      • implClasses

        public abstract CC[] implClasses
        Configuration property: Implementation classes.

        For interfaces and abstract classes this method can be used to specify an implementation class for the interface/abstract class so that instances of the implementation class are used when instantiated (e.g. during a parse).

        Example:

        @BeanConfig( implClasses={ @CC(key=MyInterface.class, value=MyInterfaceImpl.class) } )

        • BeanContext.BEAN_implClasses
        Default:
        {}

      • notBeanClasses

        public abstract Class<?>[] notBeanClasses
        Configuration property: Bean class exclusions.

        List of classes that should not be treated as beans even if they appear to be bean-like.
        Not-bean classes are converted to Strings during serialization.

        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanContext.BEAN_notBeanClasses
        Default:
        {}

      • notBeanClasses_replace

        public abstract Class<?>[] notBeanClasses_replace
        Configuration property: Add to classes that should not be considered beans.
        • BeanContext.BEAN_notBeanClasses
        Default:
        {}

      • notBeanClasses_remove

        public abstract Class<?>[] notBeanClasses_remove
        Configuration property: Remove from classes that should not be considered beans.
        • BeanContext.BEAN_notBeanClasses
        Default:
        {}

      • notBeanPackages

        public abstract String[] notBeanPackages
        Configuration property: Bean package exclusions.

        When specified, the current list of ignore packages are appended to.

        Any classes within these packages will be serialized to strings using Object.toString().

        Note that you can specify suffix patterns to include all subpackages.

        • The default value excludes the following packages:
          • java.lang
          • java.lang.annotation
          • java.lang.ref
          • java.lang.reflect
          • java.io
          • java.net
          • java.nio.*
          • java.util.*
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanContext.BEAN_notBeanPackages
        Default:
        {}

      • notBeanPackages_replace

        public abstract String[] notBeanPackages_replace
        Configuration property: Add to packages whose classes should not be considered beans.
        • BeanContext.BEAN_notBeanPackages
        Default:
        {}

      • notBeanPackages_remove

        public abstract String[] notBeanPackages_remove
        Configuration property: Remove from packages whose classes should not be considered beans.
        • BeanContext.BEAN_notBeanPackages
        Default:
        {}

      • pojoSwaps

        public abstract Class<? extends PojoSwap<?,?>>[] pojoSwaps
        Configuration property: POJO swaps.

        POJO swaps are used to "swap out" non-serializable classes with serializable equivalents during serialization, and "swap in" the non-serializable class during parsing.

        An example of a POJO swap would be a Calendar object that gets swapped out for an ISO8601 string.

        Multiple POJO swaps can be associated with a single class.
        When multiple swaps are applicable to the same class, the media type pattern defined by PojoSwap.forMediaTypes() or @Swap(mediaTypes) are used to come up with the best match.

        • BeanContext.BEAN_pojoSwaps
        • Overview > juneau-marshall > Transforms > PojoSwaps
        • Overview > juneau-marshall > Transforms > Per-media-type PojoSwaps
        • Overview > juneau-marshall > Transforms > One-way PojoSwaps
        • Overview > juneau-marshall > Transforms > @Swap Annotation
        • Overview > juneau-marshall > Transforms > Auto-detected POJO swaps
        • Overview > juneau-marshall > Transforms > Surrogate Classes
        Default:
        {}

      • pojoSwaps_replace

        public abstract Class<? extends PojoSwap<?,?>>[] pojoSwaps_replace
        Configuration property: Add to POJO swap classes.
        • BeanContext.BEAN_pojoSwaps
        Default:
        {}

      • pojoSwaps_remove

        public abstract Class<? extends PojoSwap<?,?>>[] pojoSwaps_remove
        Configuration property: Remove from POJO swap classes.
        • BeanContext.BEAN_pojoSwaps
        Default:
        {}

      • propertyNamer

        public abstract Class<? extends PropertyNamer> propertyNamer
        Configuration property: Bean property namer.

        The class to use for calculating bean property names.

        Predefined classes:

        • PropertyNamerDefault (default)
        • PropertyNamerDLC - Dashed-lower-case names.
        • PropertyNamerULC - Dashed-upper-case names.
        • BeanContext.BEAN_propertyNamer
        Default:
        org.apache.juneau.PropertyNamer.Null.class

      • sortProperties

        public abstract String sortProperties
        Configuration property: Sort bean properties.

        When true, all bean properties will be serialized and access in alphabetical order.
        Otherwise, the natural order of the bean properties is used which is dependent on the JVM vendor.
        On IBM JVMs, the bean properties are ordered based on their ordering in the Java file.
        On Oracle JVMs, the bean properties are not ordered (which follows the official JVM specs).

        This property is disabled by default so that IBM JVM users don't have to use @Bean annotations to force bean properties to be in a particular order and can just alter the order of the fields/methods in the Java file.

        • Possible values:
          • "true"
          • "false" (default)
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanContext.BEAN_sortProperties
        Default:
        ""

      • timeZone

        public abstract String timeZone
        Configuration property: Time zone.

        Specifies the default timezone for serializer and parser sessions.

        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanContext.BEAN_timeZone
        Default:
        ""

      • useEnumNames

        public abstract String useEnumNames
        Configuration property: Use enum names.

        When enabled, enums are always serialized by name, not using Object.toString().

        • Possible values:
          • "true"
          • "false" (default)
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanContext.BEAN_useEnumNames
        Default:
        ""

      • useInterfaceProxies

        public abstract String useInterfaceProxies
        Configuration property: Use interface proxies.

        If "true", then interfaces will be instantiated as proxy classes through the use of an InvocationHandler if there is no other way of instantiating them.
        Otherwise, throws a BeanRuntimeException.

        • Possible values:
          • "true" (default)
          • "false"
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanContext.BEAN_useInterfaceProxies
        Default:
        ""

      • useJavaBeanIntrospector

        public abstract String useJavaBeanIntrospector
        Configuration property: Use Java Introspector.

        Using the built-in Java bean introspector will not pick up fields or non-standard getters/setters.
        Most @Bean annotations will be ignored.

        • Possible values:
          • "true"
          • "false" (default)
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanContext.BEAN_useJavaBeanIntrospector
        Default:
        ""

      • detectRecursions

        public abstract String detectRecursions
        Configuration property: Automatically detect POJO recursions.

        Specifies that recursions should be checked for during traversal.

        Recursions can occur when traversing models that aren't true trees but rather contain loops.
        In general, unchecked recursions cause stack-overflow-errors.
        These show up as ParseExceptions with the message "Depth too deep. Stack overflow occurred.".

        The behavior when recursions are detected depends on the value for BeanTraverseContext.BEANTRAVERSE_ignoreRecursions.

        For example, if a model contains the links A->B->C->A, then the JSON generated will look like the following when BEANTRAVERSE_ignoreRecursions is true...

        {A:{B:{C:null}}}

        • Checking for recursion can cause a small performance penalty.
        • Possible values:
          • "true"
          • "false" (default)
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanTraverseContext.BEANTRAVERSE_detectRecursions
        Default:
        ""

      • ignoreRecursions

        public abstract String ignoreRecursions
        Configuration property: Ignore recursion errors.

        Used in conjunction with BeanTraverseContext.BEANTRAVERSE_detectRecursions.
        Setting is ignored if BEANTRAVERSE_detectRecursions is "false".

        If "true", when we encounter the same object when traversing a tree, we set the value to null.
        Otherwise, a BeanRecursionException is thrown with the message "Recursion occurred, stack=...".

        • Possible values:
          • "true"
          • "false" (default)
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanTraverseContext.BEANTRAVERSE_ignoreRecursions
        Default:
        ""

      • initialDepth

        public abstract String initialDepth
        Configuration property: Initial depth.

        The initial indentation level at the root.
        Useful when constructing document fragments that need to be indented at a certain level.

        • Format: integer
        • Default value: "0"
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanTraverseContext.BEANTRAVERSE_initialDepth
        Default:
        ""

      • maxDepth

        public abstract String maxDepth
        Configuration property: Max traversal depth.

        Abort traversal if specified depth is reached in the POJO tree.
        If this depth is exceeded, an exception is thrown.

        • Format: integer
        • Default value: "100"
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • BeanTraverseContext.BEANTRAVERSE_maxDepth
        Default:
        ""
